perturbation.changed_text:
1.3
“Exploit” or “Exploitation” means to use PFHOF Works for internal purposes only. This includes storage, review, and analysis, but explicitly excludes distribution, publication, or display to external parties without explicit written consent from the Village Media Company.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Exploit' is broad, covering a wide range of uses. The modified definition severely restricts this, limiting it to internal use only. This introduces a legal contradiction because subsequent sections of the contract rely on the original, broader definition to define the rights and obligations of both parties. This change creates uncertainty about the scope of the license granted, as the Village Media Company's ability to 'Exploit' PFHOF Works is now drastically different from what the rest of the agreement implies. This also has to do with federal copyright law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Act of 1976, contract law principles of mutual understanding and intent

clause (b), a “HOFV Work”).
perturbation.changed_text:
2.1
Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including, without limitation, Sections 2.3, 2.4, 2.6 and 5 below), PFHOF hereby grants to
the Village Media Company a worldwide, non-exclusive, limited, non-sublicenseable and non-assignable (except to the extent set
forth in this Agreement) right and license to (a) Exploit the PFHOF Works and (b) edit, supplement or otherwise adapt,
incorporate or otherwise utilize, the PFHOF Works to create, produce and Exploit new, original work(s) (each such work in this
clause (b), a “HOFV Work”). The Village Media Company can sublicense exploitation to any third party.
perturbation.explanation: The text explicitly states that the license is non-sublicenseable. Sub licensing involves giving a new license from an original license. Here, it has been modified so that Village Media Company CAN sublicense. This violates what the contract says originally. This alteration creates a direct contradiction within the contract regarding the sublicensing rights. This has to do with general contract law regarding agreement between two parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles of mutual agreement and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
3.5
All communication with the National Football League (the “NFL”), its 32 Member Clubs, NFL Legends and Gold Jackets shall be
made exclusively and directly through PFHOF. For the avoidance of doubt, PFHOF has the exclusive and sole relationship with
the NFL, its 32 Member Clubs, NFL Legends and Gold Jackets for any and all PFHOF and HOFV activities; provided, however,
that any communication relating to any investment by the NFL in any Village Media Company project, may be made directly
through the President of PFHOF or the Chief Executive Officer of HOFV; and, provided further, that the Village Media Company
shall have the right to present opportunities related to any of the above for approval by PFHOF.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5
All communication with the National Football League (the “NFL”), its 32 Member Clubs, NFL Legends and Gold Jackets shall be
made exclusively and directly through the Village Media Company. For the avoidance of doubt, The Village Media Company has the exclusive and sole relationship with

perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles of agency and authorized representation, potentially impacting the NFL's agreements and relationships.
